title: How to buy World Cup tickets for Gillette Stadium
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Gillette Stadium, renamed Boston Stadium, will host 7 World Cup 2026 games from June 13 to July 9.
Ticket sales began with the Visa Presale Draw; single-game tickets start at $60, premium seats up to $6,730.
Hospitality packages for Gillette Stadium games range from $5,300 to $26,700, with venue-specific packages starting at $11,150.

title: Greg Olsen spoke about getting replaced by Tom Brady
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Greg Olsen expressed frustration over how media covered his replacement by Tom Brady at Fox Sports.
Olsen clarified he held no personal animosity towards Brady and wanted him to succeed in broadcasting.
Olsen believes his perspective as a former tight end provides unique insights different from those of a quarterback.

title: Boston police release photos in late-night cellphone thefts investigation
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Boston police released photos to identify suspects in cellphone thefts from nightclubs and bar areas.
Suspects stole phones during rideshares and unsolicited rides, using threats to obtain sensitive information.
Incidents occurred in Fenway, Back Bay, Downtown, and Seaport between 11:30 p.m. and 2 a.m.

title: NBA passes new ‘heave’ rule that Payton Pritchard will love
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: The NBA will exclude missed end-of-period heaves from individual field-goal percentages starting in the 2025-26 season.
A heave is a shot from beyond 36 feet taken in the last three seconds of a quarter, previously tested in Summer League.
Celtics' Payton Pritchard supports the rule, having advocated it for over a year and making several notable heaves.

title: Watch Matt Damon and Ben Affleck in the first trailer for Netflix’s cop thriller ‘The Rip’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Matt Damon and Ben Affleck star as Miami cops in Netflix's thriller 'The Rip,' releasing January 16.
The film, directed by Joe Carnahan, follows cops who find millions in dirty money, causing tension among the team.
Additional cast includes Steven Yeun, Teyana Taylor, and Kyle Chandler; produced by Damon's and Affleck's Artists Equity.

title: Most of Mass. now in ‘significant’ drought, raising wildfire concerns
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Massachusetts declares a 'significant drought' in most areas, elevating wildfire risks following a particularly dry August.
Western Massachusetts, Connecticut River Valley, central, northeast regions, and Nantucket reach drought level two, southeast region at level one.
State officials urge residents to practice water conservation amid declining streamflow and groundwater levels, especially on Cape Cod and Nantucket.

title: Read the statement from Arthur T. Demoulas’s camp after Market Basket firing
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Arthur T. Demoulas's firing from Market Basket was described as 'predetermined' by his spokesperson.
The Market Basket board's decision follows a longstanding corporate feud with Demoulas's sisters, controlling over 60% of the company.
Demoulas remains committed to Market Basket, despite mediation efforts failing to resolve the leadership dispute.

title: Here’s why you’ll likely see long lines at Anna’s Taqueria locations today
author: John Waller
bullets: Anna's Taqueria is celebrating 30 years by offering $3.50 super burritos on September 10 in-store and online.
The promotion marks a rollback to 1995 prices and is available at all 10 Anna's Taqueria locations.
Anna's began on Beacon Street in Brookline and has expanded to locations including Woburn and Natick.

title: Patriots rookie TreVeyon Henderson announces engagement
author: John Waller
bullets: Patriots rookie running back TreVeyon Henderson announced his engagement on Instagram with a photo of his fiancée and proposal setup.
Henderson, a former Ohio State player, is known for focusing on football and faith in his social media posts.
Quarterback Drake Maye, married in June, could offer wedding-planning advice to Henderson following his recent engagement.

title: Red Sox rookie Connelly Early discussed his dominant MLB debut
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Connelly Early struck out 11, tying a Red Sox record for debut, pitching five scoreless innings against the Athletics.
Rob Refsnyder and Romy Gonzalez hit first-inning home runs in Boston's 6-0 victory over Oakland.
Early praised catcher Carlos Narváez for his game preparation and support during Early's MLB debut.
